subject: Methodology for calculation of Force Majeure Cost arising due to Farmer Agitation as Indirect Political Event under clause 34.7 of Concession Agreement- reg.
text: HRdy <5ty <THTf qiferasrut (Te45 4dent &r TTHRf #7T4, IRT FTR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) 8444 TI 011-5 Qd 6, #ar7-10 , E1W, 78 fevlt 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 3/Phone 91-11-25074100 25074200 NHAIPolicy Guidelines/ Public Private Partnership/2022 Policy Circular No.8.3.44/2022 dated 19' April, 2022 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. NHAI PD PIU-ASR/11012/2021/ForceMajeure (Comp No. 95232) & EC Agenda No. 498.07} Sub.: Methodology for calculation of Force Majeure Cost arising due to Farmer Agitation as Indirect Political Event under clause 34.7 of Concession Agreement- reg: BOT (Toll) Concessionaire are raising claims under Force Majeure because of the farmers agitation which is Indirect   Political Event under Force majeure. The costs incurred and attributable to such event and directly relating to the Project (the "Force Majeure Costs") shall be allocated and paid to Concessionaires as per clause 34.7 of the Concession Agreement. In this connection, NHAI vide policy guidelines no. 8.3.40/2021 dated 02.07.2021 issued circular related to relief to be provided to BOT (Toll) Concessionaires due to forced stoppage of toll collection at Toll Plazas on NH due to Farmer's agitation. 2. The farmer' s agitation may be considered as Indirect Political Event under Force Majeure as per provisions of Concession Agreement. Force Majeure costs is to be calculated by estimating the following parameters as per provision of respective Concession Agreement: Interest payments on debt; ii. O&M Expenses; and iii, Insurance Cover The guidelines for determining the Force Majeure Cost is detailed as below. 2.1 Force Majeure Event and associated costs The clause of Concession Agreement related to Force Majeure are reproduced here: Clause 34.7 Allocation of cost arising out of force majeure. "34.7.2. If occurrence of a Force Majeure Event after the Appointed Date, the costs incurred and attributable to such event and directly relating to the Project (the "Force Majeure Costs") shall be allocated and paid as follows: a upon occurrence Of a Non-Political Event, the Parties shall bear their respective Force Majeure Costs and neither Party shall be required to pay to the other Party any costs thereof; b upon occurrence of an Indirect Political Event; all Force Majeure Costs attributable to such Indirect Political Event, and not exceeding the Insurance Cover for such Indirect Political Event, shall be borne by the Concessionaire, and to the extent Force Majeure Costs exceed such Insurance Cover, one half of such excess amount shall be reimbursed by the Authority to the Concessionaire; and C_ upon occurrence of a Political Event, all Force Majeure Costs attributable to such Political Event shall be reimbursed by the Authority to the Concessionaire.
